title: Big Brother reboot: Tully Smyth's open letter to future contestants
text:
She rose to fame on the 2013 season of Big Brother.

And on Friday, Tully Smyth revealed she was 'jealous' of future contestants as casting begins for the upcoming 2020 season.

The reality star-turned-blogger, 32, wrote an open letter to Big Brother hopefuls, warning them about the 'dos and don'ts' of auditioning.

'I'm jealous!' On Friday, former Big Brother star Tully Smyth (pictured) penned an open letter to people auditioning for the 2020 season

In an essay for Mamamia, Tully explained that her friends from Big Brother 2013 have mixed feelings about the show making a comeback.

'It seems as if the other housemates from my year are feeling equally conflicted. Are we excited? Anxious? Jealous? Irrelevant?' she wrote.

Later on, Tully confirmed her feelings by saying she is 'jealous' of the new generation of Big Brother stars.

Mixed emotions: In an essay for Mamamia, Tully explained that her friends from Big Brother 2013 have mixed feelings about the show making a comeback

'I'm jealous. Jealous you might just be about to begin the craziest, most exhilarating, transformative journey of your life,' she wrote.

While Tully encouraged people to audition, she said they should make sure they are doing it for the right reasons.

She said housemates should be: a) confidently themselves, b) fans of the show, and c) prepared for big changes in their lives.

Tully warned that people should not apply if they simply want to be famous, win the prize money or gain followers on Instagram.

Word of advice: Tully warned that people should not apply if they simply want to be famous, win the prize money or gain followers on Instagram

'Auditioning for Big Brother was honestly the best decision I ever made and being a part of the show was the most fun I've ever had,' she concluded.

Tully appeared on the penultimate season of Big Brother in 2013, before it was cancelled by Channel Nine the following year.

The reality show originally aired from 2001 to 2008 on Channel 10, then from 2012 to 2014 on Nine. The 2020 season will air for the first time on Channel Seven.
description: The reality star-turned-blogger, 32, wrote an open letter to Big Brother hopefuls, warning them about the 'dos and don'ts' of auditioning
authors: Shive Prema For Daily Mail Australia
